title: Vocational Training Sees Renaissance as Employers Prioritize Skills
introText: Vocational and technical training programs are experiencing a renaissance as employers increasingly prioritize skills over degrees. Enrollment in trade programs has doubled in five years, driven by excellent job placement and rising wages.

content.content: Trade school enrollment has reached 2 million students, double the 2020 figure. Programs in electrician, plumbing, HVAC, and welding trades have the longest waitlists as demand far exceeds capacity.
Skilled trade wages have risen 40% in five years, with many journeymen earning $80,000 or more. Student debt is minimal compared to four-year degrees, improving return on investment.
Major employers have partnered with community colleges to create apprenticeship programs with guaranteed job placement. The model provides income during training while addressing workforce shortages.

summary: Vocational training enrollment has doubled in five years, driven by higher wages, low debt, and employer-backed apprenticeships.
